section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Agency" means a local education agency serving a population of students at least 80% of which are minority students.
"Minority student" has the meaning stated in regulations adopted by the State Superintendent.
There is a Lacrosse Opportunities Program in the Department.
The purpose of the Lacrosse Opportunities Program is to increase opportunities for minority students to participate in lacrosse in their communities.

text.section: The State Superintendent shall develop and administer the Lacrosse Opportunities Program.

section.section: An agency may submit an application to the Department to receive a grant for a program that is in furtherance of the purpose of the Lacrosse Opportunities Program.

An application shall include:
A description of the scope and purpose of the proposed program;
A business plan that includes the estimated total cost of the proposed program; and
Any other information required by the Department.

text.section:
In awarding a grant under the Lacrosse Opportunities Program, the Department shall:
Require the grantee to provide matching funds from any combination of federal, county, municipal, or private sources; and
Ensure that the grant does not exceed 50% of the total annual cost of the grantee's program.

The State Superintendent or the State Superintendent's designee shall:
Review grant applications submitted in accordance with subsection (d) of this section; and
To the extent funds are available, provide grants to agencies that meet the requirements for a grant under this section.
For fiscal year 2014 and each fiscal year thereafter, the Governor shall include in the annual budget submission at least $40,000 for the Lacrosse Opportunities Program.
The State Superintendent shall adopt regulations to implement this section.
